title: Advanced example with docopt and docopt dispatch
As with docopt, with [docopt_dispatch] you craft your
--help
c
in the
__doc__
c
variable of your entry-point module. There, you call
dispatch
c
with the doc string as argument, so it can run the parser over it.

variable of your entry-point module. There, you call
with the doc string as argument, so it can run the parser over it.

title: That being done, instead of handling manually the arguments (which usually ends up in a high cyclomatic if/else structure), you leave it to dispatch giving only how you want to handle the set of arguments.

inline_content.Text: That being done, instead of handling manually the arguments (which usually ends up in a high cyclomatic if/else structure), you leave it to dispatch giving only how you want to handle the set of arguments.

title: This is what the
dispatch.on
c
decorator is for: you give it the argument or sequence of arguments that should trigger the function, and that function will be executed with the matching values as parameters.

inline_content.Text: decorator is for: you give it the argument or sequence of arguments that should trigger the function, and that function will be executed with the matching values as parameters.
